FuncDef:
The br-ipv6-address command configures a local IPv6 address.
The undo br-ipv6-address command deletes a local IPv6 address.
By default, no local IPv6 address is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BR.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies a local IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-bit hexadecimal number in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies an IPv6 prefix length.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A CPE sends packets carrying a destination IP address that is set to the BR's local IPv6 address. To configure a local IPv6 address, run the br-ipv6-address command.
Precautions
A single local IPv6 address can be configured in each MAP-T or MAP-E instance. The local IPv6 address is mutually exclusive with an interface IP address, an address in a BRAS address pool, a NAT64 prefix address, DS-Lite local IPv6 address, and a PCPv6 server address.
